selection3_selection8:
2 Float Switches
Includes: Two float switches with harness, float assembly bracket, PVC tank adapter, cable gland, and plug assembly with cable clamp
Also available: Float Assembly (Old) (RPI Part #VPA126)
See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

selection3_selection8:
2 Float Switches
Includes: Two float switches with harness, float assembly bracket, PVC tank adapter, cable gland, and plug assembly with cable clamp
Also available: Float Assembly (Old) (RPI Part #VPA126)
See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

See Service Tip below

selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

selection3_selection8:
2 Float Switches
Includes: Two float switches with harness, float assembly bracket, PVC tank adapter, cable gland, and plug assembly with cable clamp
Also available: Float Assembly (Old) (RPI Part #VPA126)
See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

selection3_selection8:
2 Float Switches
Includes: Two float switches with harness, float assembly bracket, PVC tank adapter, cable gland, and plug assembly with cable clamp
Also available: Float Assembly (Old) (RPI Part #VPA126)
See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

selection3_selection8:
2 Float Switches
Includes: Two float switches with harness, float assembly bracket, PVC tank adapter, cable gland, and plug assembly with cable clamp
Also available: Float Assembly (Old) (RPI Part #VPA126)
See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

Part Description Updated: 9/5/2016
selection3_selection8:
2 Float Switches
Includes: Two float switches with harness, float assembly bracket, PVC tank adapter, cable gland, and plug assembly with cable clamp
Also available: Float Assembly (Old) (RPI Part #VPA126)
See Service Tip below
See Notes below for Serial Numbers this part fits
selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float switch was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA126). If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float with this version of the two float switch assembly.
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P6 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P10 (Serial # V975825 to Present)
PowerVac P14 (Serial # V975825 to Present)

selection3_selection10:
Notes:
Service Tip: Earlier versions of the PowerVac had three float switches, later PowerVac models and all PowerVac G models used two float switches. The middle float was for the liquid Evacuation Pump Option. If you have a liquid Evacuation pump connected to an earlier PowerVac you must replace the float assembly with a three float switch assembly. If there is no Evacuation pump connected to the PowerVac, you can replace the float assembly with the two float switch assembly (RPI Part #VPA125).
Models This Part Fits:
PowerVac P3 (Serial #V245092 to V975824 & 0611P3P0000 thru Present)
PowerVac P5 (Serial #V245092 to V975824 & 0611P5P0000 thru Present)
PowerVac P7 (Serial #V245092 to V975824 & 0611P7P0000 thru Present)
